content.prompt: Two samples of gas, one with two moles of helium gas and the other with two moles of xenon gas, are sealed in separate thermally conducting containers of the same volume. A xenon atom is more massive than a helium atom. The helium gas is heated until it has twice the temperature of the xenon gas. After this heating process, the two containers are placed in thermal contact, but isolated from their surroundings, and allowed to reach thermal equilibrium. Which of the following correctly indicates the direction of energy transfer between the gases, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: From the helium gas to the xenon gas, energy transfer occurs from less massive gas atoms to more massive gas atoms
From the xenon gas to the helium gas, because energy transfer occurs from regions of lower temperatures to regions of higher temperature
From the xenon gas to the helium gas, energy transfer occurs from more massive gas atoms to less massive gas atoms
From the helium gas to the xenon gas, because energy transfer occurs from regions of higher temperatures to regions of lower temperature

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
